text: When I feel emotional intensity rising, I notice it as a wave and I pause before it takes over.
I recognize the difference between emotion and truth, and I track the early stages of an emotional surge.
When I feel my feelings shift direction fast, I see them as signals, not commands.
I let my emotional swings feel like absolute truth, and I react immediately without checking what's real.
When I notice my body tightening or thoughts speeding up, I step back and breathe before responding.
I recognize when fear, stress, or old stories are amplifying my emotional reactions beyond the situation.
When I feel my mood shifting suddenly, I pause to see what triggered it before I act on it.
I let small triggers pull me into big reactions, and I take things personally even when they're not about me.
When I notice emotional hooks or patterns that pull me into instability, I interrupt them before they grow.
I recognize when my thinking becomes dramatic or overly negative, and I challenge those thoughts.
When I feel overwhelmed or confused, I name the emotion and understand what it's really pointing to.
I let emotional storms control my energy, and I explode or shut down without creating space between feeling and reacting.
When I notice early signs of emotional intensity, I prepare my response instead of being surprised by my reactions.
I recognize the difference between facts and assumptions when my emotions start to rise.
When I feel my emotional system getting activated, I slow down and choose my response instead of reacting impulsively.
I let my thoughts spiral into worst-case scenarios, and I confuse emotional truth with actual truth.
When I notice my feelings shifting between closeness and distance, I understand what's driving the change.
I recognize when fatigue, stress, or pressure are making my emotions feel bigger than they actually are.
When I feel emotional chaos rising, I create a buffer between the feeling and my reaction.
I let my emotions move faster than my ability to understand them, and I react before I see what's really happening.
